intro: Hieracium subopeatodontum, commonly known as the lesser spearthistle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its spiny, hairy stems and leaves, which are adapted to deter herbivores. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in dry, disturbed soils. Due to its hardy nature, it can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
